messages.text:
hi guys! I don’t see the history here, so excuse me for asking naive questions!
I’m looking into using Julia extensively in my quant research nowadays, and writing a bunch of functions that I was previously using from the PerformanceAnalytics package in R - that I’m hoping to put in a package soon (or as soon as possible). I’m working with TimeSeries.jl as a base. Is that a better choice, let’s say over Temporal.jl?

elements.text:
hi guys! I don’t see the history here, so excuse me for asking naive questions!
I’m looking into using Julia extensively in my quant research nowadays, and writing a bunch of functions that I was previously using from the PerformanceAnalytics package in R - that I’m hoping to put in a package soon (or as soon as possible). I’m working with TimeSeries.jl as a base. Is that a better choice, let’s say over Temporal.jl?

messages.text: Also, let me know if anyone who would is doing similar work, I’m happy to collaborate!

elements.text: Also, let me know if anyone who would is doing similar work, I’m happy to collaborate!
